identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Transcranial Random Noise Stimulation on Motor Learning in Typically Developing Adolescents
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Transcranial Random Noise Stimulation on Motor Learning in Typically Developing Adolescents

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this study is to compare motor learning rates on two different tasks, when combined with non-invasive brain stimulation.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: We will apply transcranial random noise stimulation or sham stimulation. During tRNS, participants will complete a grasping task or a reaching task. Each participant will complete both tasks, with a wait period between each task. Task order will be randomized, such that half the group will begin with each task. We will compare task scored before vs. after tRNS, for each task. This will be a measure of motor learning.

armGroups.label: Grasp Task
armGroups.description: Participants will practice a fine motor grasping task for 20 min during tRNS or sham stimulation.

armGroups.label: Reach Task
armGroups.description: Participants will practice a reaching task for 20 min during tRNS or sham stimulation.

interventions.name: transcranial random noise stimulation
interventions.description: This intervention will give children tRNS during reaching or grasping repetitive movements.

interventions.name: Sham stimulation
interventions.description: This intervention will give children sham stimulation during reaching or grasping repetitive movements.

primaryOutcomes.description: Participants will be asked to perform a grasping task, scored by number of pegs placed in a board.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before vs. Immediately after brain stimulation

primaryOutcomes.description: Participants will be asked to perform a reaching task to stack cups, scored by time taken to stack all cups.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before vs. Immediately after brain stimulation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Graded Redefined Assessment of Strength, Prehension assessment (GRASSP)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants will be asked to perform the GRASSP, scored by tallying points according to the test parametrics.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before vs. Immediately after brain stimulation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in score on second reaching task
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants will be asked to perform a reaching task to stack cups in a different pattern from Primary Outcome #2, scored by time taken to stack all cups.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before vs. Immediately after brain stimulation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 10-17 years
* Ability to follow two-step instructions
* Provides informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Presence of illness, disease

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: We will upload de-identified data onto our website and the NIH data sharing website (DASH).
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will be uploaded within 2 months of study completion and will be available in perpetuity.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Potential users will need to join DASH to access our data. Anyone who completes the DASH registration will be able to access our data.
